page.title: 11SOCIAL CONCERNS IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: The Royal Society for Mentally Handicapped and Adults (MENCAP) has a small home for 8 trainees in Trelawnyd. The main home at Rhuddlan arranges all the administrative work, and the Senior Houseparents has responsibility for the trainees who are betweem l6 and 22 years of age. he trainees are sent from all over Britain and are paid for by the Local Authorities until they are l8 years. They then require sponsorship or financing by their Social Services. There is no set scheme of work but the aim is to offer work experience for living. They receive Â£7.15 per week pocket money, and they have to learn to take responsibility for purchasing small everyday items for themselves. The trainees have work experience in running a small shop, assisting with maintenance and local renovation work.
